body:
Comment 7: 
The import path prefix you pass to -D needs to be a valid import path.
Strings containing : are not valid import paths.
If you were using the go command in directory c:\gopathtest,
it would pass -D _/c/gopathtest, which is the valid import path
it uses (by convention) for that directory.

Instead of doing this, I encourage you to use the go command
directly.  Working with the tools will be better in the long run
than working against them.

Go version 1 *is* stable, but it is also not backwards compatible
with r60.  Go version 1.1 will be backwards compatible with version 1,
and so on.

For more about what changed since r60.3, see http://golang.org/doc/go1.html

Russ
